results.title: One man's war
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Jack S. Allan and Tom Gurr
results.brief_description: Made to encourage a better understanding of the meaning of the war in Korea. The film conveys impressions of the war as experienced by an Australian infantryman. Photographed on the Australian troopship, in Japan and on the South Korean battlefields.

results.title: One man's view
results.brief_description: “Summary: paul ehrlich is professor of biology and director of graduate studies at stanford university. he is known for the urgency that he attributes to the interacting problems of pollution, population growth and resource

results.title: One man's road
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Robert Kingsbury
results.brief_description: The life of an Aborigine and his family in reserves, country situations and Sydney. Clive and Ida Williams recall the disadvantages typical of most Aborigines’ lives in New South Wales which prevent full participation in society, and their successful assimilation in the city.

results.title: One man's multinational
results.creator_credit: WGBH (Boston), Thomas Friedman and Ben Loeterman
results.brief_description: Provides a history of the Bata shoe industry and then focuses on its operation as a multinational corporation. Raises issues surrounding the motivation behind the company’s installation of factories in Third World countries such as Kenya, highlighting the controversial nature of multinational corporations as such. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: One man's hunger
results.brief_description: An analysis of the cause of famine in India and the social problem posed by inefficient methods of agriculture and over population. The story of one man who, driven off his own land by circumstances, goes to the town in search of work. He is equally unsuccessful there, and returns to starve in his own village. The problems of usury, religion and caste are brought out.

results.title: One man's history: Orwell's 'Animal farm'
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Andree Molyneux
results.brief_description: Tries to examine some of George Orwell’s motives when he wrote his famous political fable “Animal farm”, by contrasting scenes from Halas and Batchelor’s cartoon feature film with archive film of political life in Russia between the wars.
results.description: Tries to examine some of George Orwell’s motives when he wrote his famous political fable “Animal farm”, by contrasting scenes from Halas and Batchelor’s cartoon feature film with archive film of political life in Russia between the wars.

results.title: One man's garden
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Desmond Dew and Donald Winkler
results.brief_description: A tongue-in-cheek film, a mixture of documentary and dramatic effect, on the subject of garbage in general and, in particular, the part it plays in the life of a young man named Simon, cast in the role of a latter-day Adam. His fateful act of tossing away an apple core sets in motion all we know about litter, waste, garbage dumps, and the most recent development, recycling.

results.title: One man's challenge
results.creator_credit: Empire Rheumatism Council, Derek Stewart Productions, Peter Carden and George Noordhof
results.brief_description: The story of a man crippled by rheumatoid arthritis and his struggle to overcome some of the effects of his disability. To-day, much can be done by hospital and patient to arrest development of the disease.
